metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12550 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When Eclipse Mosquitto version 1.0 to 1.5.5 (inclusive) is configured to use an ACL file, and that ACL file is empty, or contains only comments or blank lines, then Mosquitto will treat this as though no ACL file has been defined and use a default allow policy. The new behaviour is to have an empty ACL file mean that all access is denied, which is not a useful configuration but is not unexpected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmosquitto1 - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
libmosquittopp1 - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
mosquitto - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
mosquitto-clients - 1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ebarretto> mosquitto's version on Trusty is EOL.

criterions.comment: mosquitto package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.15-2ubuntu0.18.04.1').
